pr_title: EIP-2315 change gascosts and update opcode

timeline.message:
update eip2315 implementation(change gastcosts)

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'upstream/master' into feature/eip2315-change-gas-cost

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure about this, would love other opinions, but do we want to still have a BerlinGasCalculator that just delegates to IstanbulGasCalculator? I think it makes it more obvious which parts of the code have been updated if we use this convention.
timeline.author: RatanRSur
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,7 +36,7 @@ public AbstractPrecompiledContractTest(
         registryFactory
             .apply(
                 new PrecompiledContractConfiguration(
-                    new BerlinGasCalculator(), PrivacyParameters.DEFAULT))

replies.bodyText:
That thought crossed my mind.  However I think making a no-op gas calculator might imply to the casual reader that there were gas cost changes in Berlin when in fact there are not currently.
If the two gas cost EIPs do make an appearance we can return it.
replies.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: I also had a doubt regarding this part. but I think that if we don't change anything it's not useful to have a GasCalculator per fork but only when we change something IMO
replies.author: matkt
